metadata.title: CVE-2023-30586 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: A privilege escalation vulnerability exists in Node.js 20 that allowedloading arbitrary OpenSSL engines when the experimental permission model isenabled, which can bypass and/or disable the permission model. The attackcomplexity is high. However, the crypto.setEngine() API can be used tobypass the permission model when called with a compatible OpenSSL engine.The OpenSSL engine can, for example, disable the permission model in thehost process by manipulating the process's stack memory to locate thepermission model Permission::enabled_ in the host process's heap memory.Please note that at the time this CVE was issued, the permission model isan experimental feature of Node.js.

criterions.comment: nodejs package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
